references.paper_title: Cingulate dynamics track depression recovery with deep brain stimulation
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it demonstrates the use of deep brain stimulation to treat depression and provides a method for quantifying changes in brain activity associated with recovery.

references.paper_title: The centrality of population-level factors to network computation is demonstrated by a versatile approach for training spiking networks
references.reason: This paper is among the most important because it introduces a new approach for training spiking neural networks that considers population-level factors, which is essential for modeling complex neural systems and understanding how neural circuits process information.

references.paper_title: Decomposed linear dynamical systems (dLDS) for learning the latent components of neural dynamics
references.reason: This paper directly relates to the current work because it introduces the decomposed linear dynamical systems (dLDS) model, which is extended and improved upon in the current paper to create the probabilistic decomposed linear dynamical systems (p-dLDS) model.

references.paper_title: CLEO: A testbed for bridging model and experiment by simulating closed-loop stimulation, electrode recording, and optogenetics
references.reason: This paper provides a new experimental testbed for studying the interactions between neural systems and stimulation, and this testbed was used to generate simulated neural data for the current work.

references.paper_title: The roles of monkey M1 neuron classes in movement preparation and execution
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it is a foundational work on the neural mechanisms underlying movement preparation and execution, and this knowledge was used to design the simulated monkey reaching task used in the current work.
